subject: Productivity
title: Mental Contrasting
description: A micro-lesson that makes Mental Contrasting usable.

hook.text: Positive fantasies about the future feel great. But they actually reduce your chances of getting there.

buildup.text: Psychologist Gabriele Oettingen found that dreaming about success tricks the brain into relaxing too soon.

discovery.text: Mental contrasting fixes this: visualize the desired future, then immediately visualize the obstacles.

twist.text: The contrast between dream and reality creates urgency. Your brain shifts from fantasy mode to action mode.

climax.text: Oettingen's WOOP method â€” Wish, Outcome, Obstacle, Plan â€” is now used in schools and clinics worldwide.

punchline.text: Dream about success, then stare at the obstacles. That's the magic combo.
